intro: Platanthera brevicalcarata, commonly known as the short-spurred lady's tresses, is a member of the Orchidaceae family. It is a terrestrial herb with a slender, erect stem that bears a dense spike of fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream sides. Its flowers have three narrow, spreading lips, with the middle lip being the most prominent. It is found primarily in North America and is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
